text:
Hello, and welcome 
to 'This is My Architecture'.

I'm Tony, and I'm here in New Zealand, 
with Evgeniy from Orion Health.
Great to be here.

So of Evgeniy, tell me a bit 
about what Orion Health does.
So we're a healthcare IT organization,

who's got more 
than 55 deployments globally,

traditionally we built our software 
for clinicians,

but these days, 
patients and consumers

are getting more and more engaged 
with their own care.

And we build solutions for that too, 
on the population health scale.

And DFD is actually 
one of our new products,
its 'Digital Front Door'.

Okay, so I understand 
the front door of a clinic,

and I understand how that's used 
to access healthcare.
But what is a digital front door?

So imagine a patient 
who's looking for information online,
about their health.

For instance, they might have 
some medical condition,

or they're taking care of someone 
who's got medical condition.

They would try and search 
for trusted health information online,

they would want to book appointments 
with health service providers,
find those service providers,

essentially, they want 
the 24/7 access to health.

And then on the other hand side, 
we've got clinicians

who are looking 
into managing those patients.

And they're interested in reducing 
the load on their systems.

So essentially, they want some sort of 
pre-filtering of those patients.

And what we want to do is 
to bring the right person at the right time,
get them to the right care.

So we at DFD website 
and Advisor Portal,
we can do that.

So DFD website pulled some data 
from the CMS,

there are lots of things behind it 
as well to provide services for patients.

Advisor Portal actually pulls data 
from health information platform.

And that's where clinicians 
are able to see patients records,

and then patient can actually go 
and search for information

they need in a single place 
at any time they want.

Okay, so obviously, 
search is important here,

and I see that Kendra icon 
in the middle here.

How does the Intelligent Search 
in Amazon Kendra
help with the digital front door?

So that's one of the most interesting 
parts of DFD.

So when we go on digital front door 
of a website,
we have the search bar.
And in that search bar,

the user is able to perform 
a search across multiple things,

like health service organizations, 
medical conditions,
make bookings,

and actually search 
for the health provider that fits them.

So in Kendra, 
we actually have the index,
that contains a lot of documents.

Essentially, there might be millions 
of documents,
and it scales quite well as well.

And that Kendra index 
actually provides API's,

which will expose why API gateways 
through that search UI Web Component.
Kho, when you see millions of documents,

I imagine there's a huge amount 
of data in healthcare,

how do you actually index 
all of that data?

So what we do, 
we use built in Kendra web crawler,
that is able to crawl static resources,

that could be static websites, 
essentially the list of data sources

that we validate with conditions 
and provide to the index.

And then we also have the custom data crawler 
that we've built using Lambda,

that is able 
to crawl dynamic resources,
pull data out of them.
It also uses DynamoDB as a queue,

and it loads those documents that it pulls 
from dynamic resources into S3 bucket.
And then from S3 bucket

Kendra seamlessly 
pulls those documents into the index,

process them 
and provides the search results to patients.

So one of the cool things 
about Kendra is also that,
it's natural language processing search.

So whenever you ask a question 
in the search bar,
it will give you the exact answer,

rather than providing you 
with keyword based search result.
And that's how it works.
Cool, thanks for sharing that with us.

It's fantastic to hear 
how the Intelligent Search in Amazon Kendra,

is able to help users get better access 
to their health care.
Thanks for helping us.

And thank you for watching 
'This is My Architecture'.
